title: Keep Your Pet Warm Indoors
description: Ensure your pet has a warm, draft-free place to sleep away from cold floors and windows.

title: Protect Their Paws
description: Use pet-safe ice melts and consider booties for walks on icy surfaces to prevent paw injuries.

title: Adjust Their Diet
description: Pets may need more calories in winter to maintain body heat. Consult your vet about dietary adjustments.

title: Limit Outdoor Time
description: Shorten walks in extreme cold and watch for signs of hypothermia like shivering or lethargy.

title: Groom Regularly
description: Keep your pet's coat clean and well-groomed. A matted coat won't provide proper insulation.

title: Check for Antifreeze
description: Antifreeze is deadly to pets. Clean up any spills immediately and store it safely.
